law.text:
One or more stockholders of a corporation may confer the right to vote or otherwise represent their stock to a trustee by:
Entering into a written voting trust agreement which specifies the terms and conditions of the voting trust;
Depositing an executed copy of the agreement with the corporation at its principal office; and
Transferring their stock for purposes of the agreement to a trustee.
